meanings.definition: To scoop out or remove something from a container or surface.
meanings.sent1: I was outscooping the sand from the bucket.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys outscooping the seeds from the watermelon.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outscooping the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The excavator was outscooping the dirt from the construction site.
meanings.sent5: He was outscooping the ice cream from the tub with precision.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo someone in scooping or gathering information or resources.
meanings.sent1: The detective was outscooping his colleagues in solving the case.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outscoop her classmates in finding the best study materials.
meanings.sent3: The spy was outscooping the enemy agents in gathering intel.
meanings.sent4: The journalist was outscooping her competitors in breaking news stories.
meanings.sent5: He was outscooping the other shoppers in getting the limited edition item.
